sen.j: 安倍 貞任 （あべ の さだとう）は、平安時代中期の武将。
sen.e: ABE no Sadato was a Japanese military commander lived during mid Heian Period.
ABE no Sadato was a Japanese military commander lived during the mid Heian Period.

sen.j: 安倍氏 (奥州)の棟梁・奥六郡の俘囚の豪族安倍頼時の第2子。
sen.e: He was born the second son to ABE no Yoritoki, the leader of the Abe clan, which was the fushu (barbarians)-turned local ruling family of Okuroku County.
He was born as the second son of ABE no Yoritoki, the leader of the Abe clan, which was a fushu (barbarians)-turned local ruling family of Okuroku County.
sen.cmt: bornの後にasを入れ、to→ofとしました。Fushuの前のtheをaにしました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of ABE no Yoritoki, the leader of the Abe clan, which was a local ruling family of fushu (Ezo people from Northeastern provinces who subjugated themselves to the Imperial Court) in Okuroku County.
sen.cmt: 俘囚（ふしゅう）についてWebで調べると、「安倍 頼時（頼良） あべの よりとき （よりよし）は 11世紀の奥州（東北地方）の俘囚（朝廷に従った蝦夷）の長とよばれた豪族です。」とあり、Ezoは"peoples formerly of northern Japan with distinct language and culture (i.e. the Ainu)"のことなので、そのように修正しました。

sen.j: 安倍厨川次郎貞任とも。
sen.e: Sadato was also called ABE no Kuriyagawa jiro Sadato.
Sadato was also called ABE no Kuriyagawa jiro Sadato.

sen.j: 義弟に妹聟の藤原経清がいる。
sen.e: His brother-in-law was FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo who was married to Sadato's younger sister.
One of his brother-in-law was FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo who was married to Sadato's younger sister.
sen.cmt: 義兄弟が何人いたか分かりませんが、「がいる」なのでOne ofを入れました。
sen.e: One of his brother-in-law was FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo who was married to Sadato's younger sister.

sen.j: 半独立的な勢力をもつ安倍氏に対し、永承6年（1051年）に平安京の朝廷から派遣された源頼義・源義家との争いに端を発し、以降12年間にわたり東北各地に善戦する（前九年の役）。
sen.e: The Imperial Court of Heian-kyo sent MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi and MINAMOTO no Yoshiie in 1051 to suppress the Abe clan which had a semi-autonomous control in the region, which ignited the 12 years of war in various places of the Tohoku region where the Abe clan fought very hard (Zen kunen no eki [the Early Nine Years' War]).

The Imperial Court of Heian-kyo sent MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi and MINAMOTO no Yoshiie in 1051 to antagonize the Abe clan which had a semi-autonomous power in the region, which ignited the 12 years of war in various places of the Tohoku region where the Abe clan fought very hard (Zen kunen no eki [the Early Nine Years' War]).
sen.cmt: 「(安倍氏に)対し」ですのでsuppress→antagonizeとしました。semi-autonomous control →semi-autonomous powerとしました。（googleでは前者のほうがヒットが多いのですが、｢勢力」はpowerの方が適切かと思われましたので。)igniteは｢燃え上がらせる｣の意味なので、適切ではないと思われます。
sen.e: The Imperial Court of Heian-kyo sent MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi and MINAMOTO no Yoshiie in 1051 to antagonize the Abe clan which had a semi-autonomous power in the region, which triggered the 12 years of war in various places of the Tohoku region where the Abe clan fought very hard (Zen kunen no eki [the Early Nine Years' War]).

sen.j: 国府側との停戦中の天喜4年（1056年）に、阿久利川において藤原光貞の営舎が襲撃される事件が起こると、頼義は張本人と断定された貞任の身柄を要求し、安倍氏がこれを拒絶して再び開戦となる。
sen.e: When the quarters of FUJIWARA no Mitsusada located by the Akuto-gawa River was attacked in 1056 under the truce accord with the Kokufu side (ancient provincial office), Yoriyoshi demanded the handover of Sadato who was determined to be the ringleader of the attack, but the Abe clan refused to it, which triggered the resumption of the war.

sen.j: 妹婿の藤原経清の協力も得て、天喜4年（1056年）には衣川の戦いに勝利する。
sen.e: The Abe clan won the Battle of Koromogawa in 1056 with a cooperation of FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo, the husband of Sadato's younger sister.
The Abe clan won the Battle of Koromogawa in 1056 cooperated by FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo, the husband of Sadato's younger sister.
sen.cmt: with a cooperation of→cooperated byにしました。
sen.e: The Abe clan won the Battle of Koromogawa in 1056 cooperated by FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo, the husband of Sadato's younger sister.

sen.j: 天喜5年（1057年）には父の頼時が戦死するものの、11月には河崎柵に拠って頼義勢を撃破。
sen.e: Although his father, Yoritoki, died in the battle field in 1057, the clan beat the Yoriyoshi army in November by efficiently using the Kawasaki no saku (stockades of Kawasaki).
Although his father, Yoritoki, died in the battle field in 1057, the clan beat the Yoriyoshi army in November through the Kawasaki no saku (stockades of Kawasaki).
Although his father, Yoritoki, died in the battle field in 1057, the clan beat the Yoriyoshi army in November through the Kawasaki no saku (stockades of Kawasaki).

sen.j: 康平5年（1062年）、国府側が出羽清原氏と結ぶと劣勢となり、9月には厨川の戦いに敗れて斬首された。
sen.e: However, when the Kokufu side built an alliance with the Dewa Kiyohara clan in 1062, the Abe clan was pushed into an inferior position, leading to the beheading of Sadato after losing the Battle of Kuriyagawa-no-saku in September.

However, when the Kokufu side built an alliance with the Dewa Kiyohara clan in 1062, the Abe clan was pushed into an inferior position, leading to the beheading of Sadato after being lost in the Battle of Kuriyagawa in September.
sen.cmt: losing the Battle→being lost in the Battleにしました。Kuriyagawa-no-saku→Kuriyagawaにしました。
sen.e: However, when the Kokufu side built an alliance with the Dewa Kiyohara clan in 1062, the Abe clan was pushed into an inferior position, leading to the beheading of Sadato after being lost in the Battle of Kuriyagawa in September.

sen.j: その首は丸太に釘で打ち付けられ、朝廷に送られた（この故事に倣い、後年源頼朝によって藤原泰衡の首も同様の措置がされた。平泉の中尊寺に現存する泰衡の首には、釘の跡が残っている）。
sen.e: The head of Sadato was nailed on a log and sent to the Imperial Court (in later years, the head of FUJIWARA no Yasuhira was also sent by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo to the Court in the same way.

sen.j: 衣川の戦いにおいては、源義家と和歌の問答歌をしたとされる逸話も知られる。
sen.e: According to one anecdote, Sadato exchanged Mondoka (poetries in the form of question and answer) with MINAMOTO no Yoshiie during the Battle of Koromogawa.

sen.j: 津軽地方の豪族・安東氏（のち秋田氏）は貞任の子、高星の後裔を称した。
sen.e: The Ando clan (later, the Akita clan), the local ruling family of the Tsugaru region, designated themselves as descendants of ABE no Takaboshi, a son of Sadato.
